name: Chem-Words Review - Set 3
description:
This is the third program of a set of 3 which are used for the end of year review of course material in High School and First-year College Chemistry.

     This program is designed for reviewing and testing the student’s knowledge of basic chemistry terminology as would be covered in a first year college or an accelerated high school chemistry class.      It covers a total of 143 terms, definitions, and items divided up into 3 main categories: 1) Kinetics & Equilibrium, 2) Acids & Bases, and 3) Redox & Electrochemistry. There are 9 game screens. There is a screen where you are given a tile with information and you must click the mouse on the best match. The positions of tiles are  scrambled each time and the definitions are presented in a random order.  Each level has a Hint key. The is a printable end report screen. There is also a list of the terms and definitions.
     This is a TOTAL FREEWARE Windows program. This means there are no ads, no registration, no collection of any data, no internet connection, and no limit to installations or distribution. The program will run on Windows versions 7 through 10.  Download the zipped setup program, extract it and run it.
NOTE: This program will run fairly well on Linux (Linuxmint & Peppermint OS) when used with Wine or PlayOnLinux. Game play is okay, although veiwing the word list and printing the end report may be compromised depending on your Linux system.
